rules: Rule1: Either the designer uses sustainable material or the designer has a successful show.
Rule2: If the designer secures a venue permit, then the designer completes a safety inspection.
Rule3: Either the designer secures a venue permit or the designer gets media coverage.

Rule4: Under the condition that the designer gets media coverage, if the designer obtains sponsorship, then whenever the designer promotes the event, provided the venue is prepared, hosting a design show leads to a successful show.

Rule5: Provided that the designer completes a safety inspection, if the designer obtains sponsorship, then under the condition that the event is promoted, whenever the venue is prepared, hosting a design show results in a successful show.
Rule6: If the designer decorates the space, then whenever the designer hosts a design show, a successful show follows.
Rule7: If the designer postpones the event, then the designer does not cancel the show.
Rule8: Either the designer buys eco-friendly furniture or it is not the case that the designer uses sustainable material.
Rule9: Whenever the designer receives awards, the designer gains recognition.
Rule10: Either the designer receives awards or, if the designer invites guests, then provided the venue is prepared, hosting a design show leads to a successful show.
Rule11: If the designer innovates techniques, then the designer pioneers a style.
Rule12: If the designer creates a design platform, then the designer does not buy eco-friendly furniture.
Rule13: Under the condition that the designer invites guests, the designer promotes the event.
Rule14: Either the designer invites guests or the designer schedules a show date.
Rule15: If the designer schedules a show date, then provided the venue is prepared, hosting a design show results in a successful show.
Rule16: If it is not the case that either the designer exceeds the budget or the designer does not delay the project, then the designer cancels the show.
Rule17: If it is not the case that pioneering a style implies not gaining recognition, then the designer establishes a trend.
Rule18: Under the condition that it is not the case that pioneering a style implies not gaining recognition, the designer does not establish a trend.
Rule19: If it is not the case that preparing the venue implies decorating the space, then the designer delays the project.

Rule20: Provided that it is not the case that not (either the designer exceeds the budget or the designer does not delay the project) implies the designer postpones the event, the designer loses a deposit.

Rule21: If it is not the case that not (not (either the designer exceeds the budget or the designer does not delay the project) implies the designer postpones the event) implies the designer does not lose a deposit, then the designer faces penalties.

Rule22: Provided that it is not the case that not (not (either the designer exceeds the budget or the designer does not delay the project) implies the designer postpones the event) implies the designer does not lose a deposit, the designer does not face penalties.
Rule23: If the designer does not create a design platform, then the designer publishes a design publication.
facts: Fact3: The designer hosts a design show.
Fact4: The designer prepares a venue.
Fact5: The designer does not exceed the budget.
Fact6: The designer does not publish a design publication.

question: The designer has a successful show.
